text: Broken gauntlets still adorn the arms, their damaged remains no more than an illustration of resilience.
Light gauntlets of leather and scale, soaked in the blood of their wearer's enemies.
Moderately heavy gauntlets, for treading the line between mobility and power.
Plate gauntlets of brass and iron, an impenetrable wall between their wearer and their soon-to-be victims.
Sharp metal spikes adorn the menacing Khornate gauntlets, adding brutal lethality to every unarmed strike.
Khorne's fiery temper blisters and burns across the surface of the gauntlets, ignited by the hellish fires of Chaos.
Large and powerful, the arms are thick with muscle and imbued with unnatural strength.
The arms are blackened and burnt, charred completely but for the glowing embers that remain, still burning bright at the fingertips.
The twisted energies of Chaos flow through the arms, glowing a deep and violent red.
A sturdy metal gauntlet is worn on the arms, granting immeasurable power in a single fist.
A light gauntlet protects the arm, ensuring no errant slashes will cause any harm.
Razor-sharp spikes protrude from the arms, capable of tearing through meat and bone.
Thin, bird-like wrists support the hands, where razor-sharp talons grow, clutching an ever watchful eye, its gaze flitting over all.
The arms are wrapped in thick metal bands, where skin and feather bulge between each chain.
Intricately decorated bracers cover the arm, offering little in the way of sturdiness.
The whole arm is protected by a heavy bracer of multiple parts, leaving very little skin uncovered.
The arms are lined with thick barbs running along their length, each capable of dealing a fatal injury.
Decorative ringlets circle the arms, glinting in the sunlight.
The arms are swollen to an enormous size, the flesh putrefying on the bone.
Diseased spikes stand out from the arm, adding devastating cutting power to their immense weight.
The overwhelming fat of the arm has burst the gauntlet above, cracking the armour and leaving the flesh exposed.
The light gauntlet strains to hold together over the ever fattening arm it is intended to protect.
A vast expanse of metal as been hammered together into an ugly gauntlet, protecting the soft, fatty tissue underneath.
Shoulder to fingertip, the diseased, corpulent arm is protected by thick, heavy plate.
The flesh of the arm is wholly mutated. Where once the lower arms and hands belonged, wicked, deadly scythes grow instead.
The sharp, bladed edge of the scythes are serrated to better carve through swathes of enemies.
Teeth-like fangs run along the inner edge of the blade, that a foe might feel their bite with every swing.
Where the inside edge of each scythe is a lethally keen blade, the other is spiked, capable of brutal blunt force.
Each scythe is reinforced by ornately-decorated armour, capturing a most deadly beauty.
A wicked and foul Daemonic energy pulsates from the scythes, corrupting the very air through which they cut.
Broken gauntlets still adorn the arms, their damaged remains no more than an illustration of resilience.
Light gauntlets of leather and scale, soaked in the blood of their wearer's enemies.
Moderately heavy gauntlets, for treading the line between mobility and power.
Plate gauntlets of brass and iron, an impenetrable wall between their wearer and their soon-to-be victims.

Khorne's fiery temper blisters and burns across the surface of the gauntlets, ignited by the hellish fires of Chaos.

A sturdy metal gauntlet is worn on the arms, granting immeasurable power in a single fist.
A light gauntlet protects the arm, ensuring no errant slashes will cause any harm.

Thin, bird-like wrists support the hands, where razor-sharp talons grow, clutching an ever watchful eye, its gaze flitting over all.
The arms are wrapped in thick metal bands, where skin and feather bulge between each chain.
Intricately decorated bracers cover the arm, offering little in the way of sturdiness.
The whole arm is protected by a heavy bracer of multiple parts, leaving very little skin uncovered.
The arms are lined with thick barbs running along their length, each capable of dealing a fatal injury.
Decorative ringlets circle the arms, glinting in the sunlight.
The arms are swollen to an enormous size, the flesh putrefying on the bone.
Diseased spikes stand out from the arm, adding devastating cutting power to their immense weight.
The overwhelming fat of the arm has burst the gauntlet above, cracking the armour and leaving the flesh exposed.
The light gauntlet strains to hold together over the ever fattening arm it is intended to protect.
A vast expanse of metal as been hammered together into an ugly gauntlet, protecting the soft, fatty tissue underneath.
Shoulder to fingertip, the diseased, corpulent arm is protected by thick, heavy plate.
The flesh of the arm is wholly mutated. Where once the lower arms and hands belonged, wicked, deadly scythes grow instead.
The sharp, bladed edge of the scythes are serrated to better carve through swathes of enemies.
Teeth-like fangs run along the inner edge of the blade, that a foe might feel their bite with every swing.
Where the inside edge of each scythe is a lethally keen blade, the other is spiked, capable of brutal blunt force.
Each scythe is reinforced by ornately-decorated armour, capturing a most deadly beauty.
A wicked and foul Daemonic energy pulsates from the scythes, corrupting the very air through which they cut.
The protective helm is lightly decorated with a short feather plume adorning the rear.
A helm of exquisite detail, with horns, large and ornate, stemming from either side.
A long tassel of tied hair hangs from the back of the helm, swaying hypnotically with every movement.
Plumed decoratively down the centre, the helm is as much a work of art as it is a piece of armour.
Long feathers decorate the helm, creating an air of cruel beauty worthy of the Prince of Pleasure.
Through the narrow slit of the occularium, the wicked glint of the eyes is all that is visible of the face in this beautifully adorned helm.
The protective helm is lightly decorated with no need for excessive plumage or trinkets.
The face is partially hidden under the decorative mask, which leaves much to be desired.
Short horns erupt through broken skin, arching into a terrible, Daemonic crown.
Large vine-like horns twist and turn around each other, bending into one another until the bony structures intertwine.
The large, misshapen horns are decorated with bells to warn enemies of the imminent danger.
As monstrously sharp as the tip of a blade, the horns stretch towards a sky darkened by Chaos.
The horns sit low, tilted as if readied to impale victims with a devastating charge.
One horn stands splintered and broken, snapped in the midst of the violent carnage of battle.
Fortified with brass, these low, spear-like horns point ahead with deadly intent.
Charred black with ash, these razor-tipped horns blaze bright with eternal flame.
Plagued horns have broken through the skin to become the main feature.
These frail horns have bent, broken and snapped in the heat of battle.
Nurgle's influence has caused multiple spikes to erupt from the skull, infesting the whole head.
A horned and hideous countenance from which sharp fangs and an animalistic snout protrude.
Forward-pointed horns and a ringed snout manifest as the physical embodiments of Khorne's malignant fury.
The head – beastly and contorted – is adorned with the shattered horns of one well-versed in brutality and bloodshed.
Bloody trophies of the slain hang from the beard and horns, serving as a grim warning to all.
Any horrors of the face lie hidden behind this sturdy and elaborate helm.
The accursed fire of Khorne's murderous rage sets ablaze the whole length of the horns.
Mutated in Tzeentch's image, the head is beaked and lightly feathered to better mirror the mysteries of the Lord of Change.
The feathers clump together on the head, growing in ugly tufts.
The beak sharpens to a long and lethal point.
Broken and bent beyond repair, only the remnants of a once proud beak remain.
Plated in finely adorned armour, the beak is well protected, and decorated with a remarkable pendant, hanging always in flux.
Concealed by a terrible, horned mask, its wearer remains shrouded in mystery.
Alluding to Tzeentch's image, a beak protrudes to mirror that of the Lord of Change.
Plucked, broken and bent out of shape, only the remnants of a once-proud beak remain.
The head is pallid and bloated with disease, bearing a single eye at its centre and a plague-ridden horn at its crest.
Weakened by decay and decomposition, the horns have snapped under the force of a mighty blow.
Devastating spikes erupt from the fleshy features of the face, infesting the whole head.
Large, twisting horns grow from the rotund head, bending into each other until the bony structures intertwine.
The large, misshapen horns are decorated with bells to warn enemies of the imminent danger.
Hideous, growth-like horns sprout from the head, twisting and turning in every direction.
Huge bands of muscle envelope the legs, and each stride thrums palpably with power.
Gruesome trophies are tied around the waist, callously plucked from the corpses of fallen victims.
The Daemonic fires of the Chaos Realms have scorched and charred the feet and lower legs, leaving the blackened skin solid and impenetrable.
From the coarse skin of the legs erupt deadly spurs, fit to draw blood on the slightest contact.
Heavy iron plate covers the entirety of the legs, serving as strong protection against any weapon.
The lower legs are protected by heavy iron greaves, while the thigh remains primarily uncovered.
The thick, bestial legs are stunted and short, with thick patches of coarse fur growing above dark, cloven hooves.
Between patches of fur, chains and rings of brass are visible, wrapped around the legs and pulsating with corrupting energy.
From large, iron plates welded into the skin hang the bones and sorrows of the slain.
Muscle bulges between each line of unyielding metal chain, pulled completely taut around the legs.
The legs are entirely armoured, with huge plates needed to protect the broad width of the thigh.
While the thigh remains bare but for patchy tufts of fur, the lower legs are strapped with thick, metal armour.
The thick, bestial legs are stunted and short, with thick patches of coarse fur growing above dark, cloven hooves.
While the thigh remains bare but for patchy tufts of fur, the lower legs are strapped with thick, metal armour.
Long feathers cover the thighs of these thin, avian legs, giving way to coarse skin towards the taloned feet.
Between the feathers of the thigh grow large and lethal spines.
Gleaming ringlets and chains encircle the ankles, drawing the gaze of allies and enemies alike.
The bony, avian legs are fully guarded by heavy mail and plate, eliminating most vulnerabilities.
The heavy, iron greaves reach as far as the knee, where the fragile, thinness of the leg gives way to robust muscle.
A loincloth is worn at the waist, emitting the strange and mysterious magic of Tzeentch.
The heavy, iron greaves reach as far as the knee; jewels and carvings decorate the plates.
Influenced by Tzeentch, these legs have been shaped and granted talons to give the appearance of the Lord of Change.
The legs are fat and bulbous, and rife with Nurgle's foul decay.
Revolting pustules on the legs have burst open, revealing large spikes growing through the skin.
These legs are ridden with pestilence, where large buboes form, seeping with abhorrent odour and pus.
The potency of Nurgle's decay has affected even the leg armour, which has weakened and deteriorated with festering rot.
Slick with the same revolting ooze that drips from the skin, these light greaves do naught to obscure the stink.
The armour strains under the task of encompassing the whole leg, but provides adequate protection nonetheless.
The armour strains under the task of encompassing the whole leg; thorned spikes cause much pain for any attackers.
These pale, digitigrade legs are primarily unadorned, exposed entirely to the corrupting influence of Chaos.
Metal straps and jewellery adorn the legs, offering some small measure of protection and decoration.
Several horns and spikes sprout haphazardly from the skin, adorning the legs with a most deadly decoration.
Skulls and withered appendages are clasped to a belt at the waist, glorious trophies of battle and domination.
The legs remain mostly bare, but for the light greaves that ensure large expanses of skin remain displayed.
When the need for protection outweighs any salacious intent, heavy greaves are worn up to the hock of the leg.
The legs remain mostly bare, but for the light greaves that ensure large expanses of skin remain displayed.
When the need for protection outweighs any salacious intent, heavy greaves are worn up to the hock of the leg.
The spine leads into a Daemon tail, long and smooth to the touch.
The tail is tipped by a lethal brass spike, able to strike with the force of any spear.
Where the illuminating glow of the flame ends, the blackened, calcified flesh of the tail begins.
Along the length of the tail grow brutal spines; fragments of bone so sharp they have forced their way through the skin.
Like a living mace, lengthy spikes grow from the end of the tail that are capable of bludgeoning enemies and smashing their skulls into splinters.
The tail is armoured, adding both protection and weight to its blunt and heavy strike.
A fat, slug-like tail oozing with the rotten miasma of death and decay.
Eroded by its own rot, the armour shielding the tail is broken, decrepit and feeble.
Atop the slimy secretions of the tail is attached a layer of heavy armour for shelter.
Spikes rise above the layer of grime that coats the skin of the tail, their cut sure to leave behind sickness and malady.
Swollen pustules and buboes coat the tail, leaking the abhorrent and insidious corruption of Nurgle.
Each swollen and infected joint of the tail is wrapped with chains, where the broken skulls of past victims are tied, eternally dragging behind.
The tail is smooth and strong, and always poised as if ready to sting.
Decorative ringlets loop along the tail, promoting an air of fiendish finesse and allure.
The scorpion-like appearance of the tail is only somewhat obscured by the plate armour attached along its length.
The tail is shielded by an imposing armour of metal spikes, guarding it from the enemies of Chaos.
Hooks and chains entwine around the tail, rusted and bloody from all manner of cruel delights.
A scythe-like blade has mutated at the end of the tail, able to skewer enemies in one savage thrust.
A hungry, malevolent mouth thrashes at the end of the tail, twisting and turning in search of easy prey.
Plated in heavy armour, the tail is increasingly reckless in hungrily seeking its victims.
The suffocating bind of chains has done little to quell the vicious nature of the tail.
The destructive spines on this sentient tail make its hunger for mayhem all the easier to sate.
Arrow heads and gouging scars devastate the tail, yet its relentless spite and hostility remain undiminished.
The malevolent, bloodthirsty energy of Khorne permeates the tail, radiating from it in Chaotic waves of pure hate.
An air of mystical sentience surrounds the tail, thrashing and snapping at will.
Heavily plated with metal, the tail writhes uncontrollably wreaking havoc with its weight.
The tail is decorated in ringlets and jewellery, though whether to the tastes of its owner or the tail itself remains unknown.
Small, edged teeth grow across the tail, delivering a thousand cuts with a single swipe.
Ferocious, snapping teeth fill the numerous mouths that line the tail, each one seeking to sate its own endless hunger.
Magical Daemonic energy thrums along the tail, as iridescent and captivating as it is corrupting.
A lithe and graceful body of indeterminate gender, as powerful and abhorrent as it is strangely alluring.
Bloody carvings decorate the rent flesh of the body, twisting in chaotic patterns that honour the Dark Prince Slaanesh.
Both gleaming jewels and grisly trophies decorate the body, a testament of strength and prestige in the Realms of Chaos.
Pristine armour of heavy plate is sculpted to the body and shoulders, hugging every shape and curve.
Heavy armour that moulds to the body, leaving the shoulders bare.
The armour is thin and light, protecting little and covering up even less.
The body is a wall of pure muscle, with the Mark of Chaos worn proudly on the chest.
Simple straps of leather armour protect the body, with thick pauldrons attached at the shoulders.
As large and brutish as the Blood God himself, this body bears the searing Mark of Khorne.
With the Mark of Nurgle displayed clearly on the chest, this body is a conduit of death and decay.
The perfectly-formed Mark of Slaanesh adorns the smooth, desirable skin of the chest.
Imbued with terrible, arcane knowledge, the Mark of Tzeentch is borne as a stamp of pride on the body.
Forming a cross on the chest, the dual leather straps make a taunting target for the enemies of Chaos.
Small horns and spikes erupt from the skin, leaving a spiny trail across the body.
The body is shielded by an armour of thick, heavy plate.
Heavy armour protects the chest, while the lack of pauldrons reduces any limitation on mobility.
The body has morphed and mutated into a bird-like physique, with light tufts of feathers sprouting from the skin.
The weight of heavy jewellery is nothing to one who carries the weight of Tzeentch's dark knowledge.
Leather straps hold down the feathers growing along the torso in patches, providing a small amount of protection.
A heavy chest piece protects the slim avian physique.
Heavy plate chest armour and pauldrons provide maximum protection against all manner of weapons.
The deep runes carved into the body swirl and glow with magical energy.
Corruption leeches from the sharp metal spikes of the collar, leaving its dark infection glowing in its wearers veins.
Below the brass collar at the neck is worn a band of tough leather worn across the stomach, plated for added protection.
Dual straps of leather and metal cross the chest, hiding little of the corrupting effects from the collar above.
Metal plates line the body, welded into the skin and adorned with the gruesome trophies of death and victory.
The collar rests uneasily between the large spines of bone that jut from the shoulders and back.
Simple fur pauldrons protect the shoulders, attached to the Khornate brass collar tightly encircling the neck.
A gargantuan mass of flesh and rot, this body is rancid with decay.
Spikes break out through the skin of the stomach, chest and back, dripping disease from every tip.
Large horns protrude from all across the body, poking out between grime-covered folds of fat.
Victims of Nurgle's disease and decay have their bones hung as trophies from the body.
Bearing deadly plague, the body is engulfed in hideous and swollen, pus-filled buboes.
Small bells bounce and ring loudly as the body bounds towards its next victim.
Pure Chaos exudes from the body in waves, releasing powerful magical energy.
The body burns with the raging fires of Khorne, the red mist of wrath enveloping the skin.
The dark and alluring energy of Slaanesh surrounds the body, pulsing in an aura of seduction.
The pungent miasma of filth and disease is released from the body; a cloud of Nurgle's pestilence infecting the surrounding area.
A swirling, cosmic radiance surrounds the body, wrapping the skin in the magic of Tzeentch.
Turbulent black smoke engulfs the body, partially shrouding it in its dark embrace.
Pure Chaos exudes from the body in waves, releasing powerful magical energy.
The body burns with the raging fires of Khorne, the red mist of wrath enveloping the skin.
The dark and alluring energy of Slaanesh surrounds the body, pulsing in an aura of seduction.
The pungent miasma of filth and disease is released from the body; a cloud of Nurgle's pestilence infecting the surrounding area.
A swirling, cosmic radiance surrounds the body, wrapping the skin in the magic of Tzeentch.
Turbulent black smoke engulfs the body, partially shrouding it in its dark embrace.
Though many Daemon Princes bear monstrous wings upon their backs, no such mutation has manifested here.
A set of dark, leathery wings protrude from the back, unfolding between spines of bone into an expanse of rugged skin.
The wings are hidden beneath reinforced armour, providing a durable layer of iron protection between sword and skin.
Sharp, bloody fangs tip every joint of the wings, turning the appendages into deadly weapons in the service of Chaos.
The wings are blackened and crisp, burned and mutated by the eternal embers of Chaos.
The wounds of war scar these wings, where the taut skin has been torn and frayed in the tumult of battle.
Large and broad, these wings cast a great shadow as they take flight, blocking out the sun and leaving darkness in their wake.
Metal plates have been fixed to the wings, a curtain of brass over powerful muscle.
Heavy iron chains wrap the wings, where tied skulls sway threateningly – a message to all who would invoke the wrath of Khorne.
With long and twisting horns growing from the joints, the wings cut an imposing silhouette, even amidst the horrors of the Chaos Realms.
Fury and bloodlust fuel the fires of Khorne, which have scorched the wings black but for a few undying cinders that remain hauntingly aglow.
Carnage and slaughter have left their mark in the bloody tears and gauges of the wings.
Large feathered wings sprout from the back, like those of an agile and predatory bird of prey.
The wings are bedecked in jewels and chains, a symbol of the prestige in serving the Lord of Change.
The glorious sheen of feathers is shielded beneath large, protective plates of armour.
Spurs and spikes of exposed bone stand tall, parting the feathers of the wing.
Age has withered these wings, marred by raw skin and missing feathers that fall in dreary clumps.
The wings blaze with a mystical flame, Daemonic energy pulsing from them in waves of Tzeentchian magic.
These old withered wings are covered in exposed bone with spikes erupting outwards.
Virulent disease seeps from these wings, infecting all those unfortunate enough to fall under their shadow.
A plague of pestilent sores on the wings are forced open by the venomous spikes that have erupted from beneath.
Though well plated, no armour can disguise the decay that corrodes these wings.
The skulls tied from these wings are swarmed by flies as they follow the rank stench of decomposition.
Buboes of pus and gore blister across the wings, dripping endlessly with deadly disease.
Degraded by their own toxicity, these wings are torn and decayed, weakened by the pestilence that ravages their flesh.
The smooth, pale skin of the wings is interrupted by numerous scars, disfiguring the thin, veined flesh between each joint.
The wings are armoured, concealing the most vulnerable of flesh in its protective embrace.
The fragile, ashen skin of the wings is ripped, torn and mangled from the harsh and unforgiving trials of war.
Rusted metal hooks grip the wings, between which heavy chains are draped.
Where pallid flesh meets bone, sharp fangs grow, creating a lethal tip at each joint of the wing.
Magic ripples and undulates through and around the wings, faintly glowing with mystical energies.
The whole limb is wreathed in arcane energies, scorching with unbearable heat.
This arm cries out for a blade to complete it, bearing the sorcerous fires of Tzeentch.
A burning heat is visible behind the eyes, as if blue Tzeentchian flame scorches the skull itself.
Powerful muscles strain beneath the skin, itching to storm towards the Great Conspirator's enemies.
Shifting and coiling, this tail cuts through the air with serpentine grace and deadly power.
Every muscle is imbued with occult energy, guarding against the darkest of spells.
Malevolent arcane energy seeps from the blade, letting it bite through armour and dampen all resistance to enchantment.
The edge of this blade could slice through anything, allowing Tzeen'neth's dark energy to seep into every cut.
Paralysing arcane tendrils emanate from this devastating blade, leaving its victims helpless before the Winds of Magic.
The tentacles are alive and capable of drawing arcane energy from the air itself.
